intro: Cryptolepis intricata, commonly known as the intricate cryptolepis, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
